Based on the calibration slope series, a linear model is used to
Based on the calibration slope series, a linear model is used to

describe the varying trend with DSL:
describe the varying trend with DSL:

Slopei=aiDSL+bi

The calibration coefficients present a linear trend with DSL.
The calibration coefficients present a linear trend with DSL.

Annual periodicity exists especially in the short-wave and the water vapor channels.
Annual periodicity exists especially in the short-wave and the water vapor
channels.

•Relatively good linear fitting result.

•Short wave channel(CH3,4,1) has more abnormal points.

•CH1,2,4 are mostly underestimated.
•CH1,2,4 are mostly underestimated.

•CH5,6 are almost all underestimated.

•CH7 is mostly overestimated.
•CH7 is mostly overestimated.

•Standard deviation decrease with increasing wavelength except for CH7.

•RMS of Dif(%) is 2.65~3.66% except for CH5.

•Calibration coefficients during annual field campaign at Dunhuang in Aug. 2010 were estimated using the formula from multi-sites tracking analysis.

from multi-sites tracking
analysis.

•The percent difference between estimated coefficients and vicarious calibration with in- situ data are below 5%(exept for CH18).

Double Difference Analysis with MODIS
Double Difference Analysis with MODIS

• The multi-sites radiometric calibration tracking method could provide the re-calibration coefficients for MERSI.
• The multi-sites radiometric calibration tracking method
could provide the re-calibration coefficients for MERSI.

• This current method is not good for water absorption
• This current method is not good for water absorption

channels. Near real-time humidity profiles may be helpful to improve.
channels. Near real-time humidity profiles may be helpful
to improve.

• Primary re-calibration performance shows that the RMS percentage difference with MODIS is 5.6, 3.5, 3.4 and 3.4% for MERSI bands at 470, 550, 650 and 865 nm by double differencing, but MERSI is systematically larger at 470nm .
• Primary re-calibration performance shows that the RMS
percentage difference with MODIS is 5.6, 3.5, 3.4 and
3.4% for MERSI bands at 470, 550, 650 and 865 nm by
double differencing, but MERSI is systematically larger
at 470nm .
